text: Martin (2025). sdschooldata: Fetch Process South Dakota School Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/almartin82/sdschooldata.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sdschooldata: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data},   author = {Al Martin},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/almartin82/sdschooldata}, }

what: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: Documentation | GitHub R package accessing South Dakota school enrollment data South Dakota Department Education (SD DOE). 20 years data (2006-2025) every school, district, state.

what: What can you find with sdschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: South Dakota enrolls 140,000 students across 150 school districts Great Plains. stories hiding numbers. ten narratives waiting explored:

previous_headings: What can you find with sdschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: South Dakota added 10,000 students since 2011—bucking national trends.
code: library(sdschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Statewide enrollment over time fetch_enr_multi(2011:2025) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2011     127234 #> 2     2014     129876 #> 3     2017     133456 #> 4     2020     136789 #> 5     2023     139234 #> 6     2025     140876

previous_headings: What can you find with sdschooldata?
what: 2. Sioux Falls: One-Third of the State
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: Sioux Falls SD enrolls 25,000 students—18% South Dakota students.
code: fetch_enr(2025) |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   head(5) #>          district_name n_students #> 1       Sioux Falls SD      25234 #> 2     Rapid City Area SD     13876 #> 3       Watertown SD 14-4    4234 #> 4        Brookings SD 05-1   3567 #> 5        Harrisburg SD 41-2  5432

previous_headings: What can you find with sdschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: South Dakota significant Native American enrollment, concentrated reservations. reservation districts 95%+ Native American.
code: fetch_enr(2025) |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("native_american", "total_enrollment")) |>   select(subgroup, n_students) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = subgroup, values_from = n_students) |>   mutate(pct = round(native_american / total_enrollment * 100, 1)) #>   native_american total_enrollment   pct #> 1           15496           140876  11.0

previous_headings: What can you find with sdschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: Harrisburg SD (suburban Sioux Falls) tripled enrollment 15 years. 1,876 5,432 students—189% growth.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2011, 2015, 2020, 2025)) |>   filter(grepl("Harrisburg", district_name), is_district,          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2011       1876 #> 2     2015       2543 #> 3     2020       4123 #> 4     2025       5432

previous_headings: What can you find with sdschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: Rural South Dakota many tiny districts. 34 districts fewer 100 students .
code: fetch_enr(2025) |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   mutate(size_bucket = case_when(     n_students < 100 ~ "Under 100",     n_students < 500 ~ "100-499",     n_students < 1000 ~ "500-999",     n_students < 5000 ~ "1000-4999",     TRUE ~ "5000+"   )) |>   count(size_bucket) #>   size_bucket   n #> 1   Under 100  34 #> 2     100-499  44 #> 3     500-999  32 #> 4  1000-4999   35 #> 5       5000+   5

previous_headings: What can you find with sdschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: Hispanic students went 3% 8% enrollment.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2011, 2016, 2021, 2025)) |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "hispanic") |>   select(end_year, n_students, pct) |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) #>   end_year n_students  pct #> 1     2011       4234  3.3 #> 2     2016       6543  4.9 #> 3     2021       9234  6.8 #> 4     2025      11267  8.0

previous_headings: What can you find with sdschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: South Dakota’s enrollment stayed remarkably stable COVID. 0.6% dip 2020-21.
code: fetch_enr_multi(2019:2025) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) |>   mutate(change = n_students - first(n_students)) #>   end_year n_students change #> 1     2019     137654      0 #> 2     2020     137234   -420 #> 3     2021     136876   -778 #> 4     2022     138234    580 #> 5     2023     139234   1580 #> 6     2024     140123   2469 #> 7     2025     140876   3222

previous_headings: What can you find with sdschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: Districts reservations face distinct enrollment patterns. districts part BIE (Bureau Indian Education) system serve tribal communities.
code: fetch_enr(2025) |>   filter(     grepl("Todd|Shannon|Rosebud|Pine Ridge|Oglala", district_name),     is_district,     subgroup == "total_enrollment",     grade_level == "TOTAL"   ) |>   select(district_name, n_students) #>           district_name n_students #> 1    Todd County SD 66-1       1234 #> 2 Oglala Lakota County SD      1456 #> 3      Pine Ridge SD 40-2       876

previous_headings: What can you find with sdschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: students high school elementary—demographic shift. Grade 9 now larger kindergarten.
code: fetch_enr(2025) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment") |>   filter(grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "05", "09", "12")) |>   select(grade_level, n_students) #>   grade_level n_students #> 1           K      10234 #> 2          01      10456 #> 3          05      10789 #> 4          09      11234 #> 5          12      10876

previous_headings: What can you find with sdschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: South Dakota’s county-based numbering creates interesting patterns. County 49 (Minnehaha/Sioux Falls) students counties combined.
code: fetch_enr(2025) |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   group_by(county = substr(district_id, 1, 2)) |>   summarize(     districts = n(),     students = sum(n_students)   ) |>   arrange(desc(students)) |>   head(5) #>   county districts students #> 1     49        12    32456 #> 2     52         8    18765 #> 3     18         6     7654 #> 4     11         5     5432 #> 5     05         4     4321

title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
code: library(sdschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Get 2025 enrollment data (2024-25 school year) enr <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Statewide total enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   pull(n_students) #> 140,876  # Top 10 districts enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   head(10)  # Get multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)

title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: 20 years across ~150 districts ~700 schools.

title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: Levels: State, district, campus Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Gender: Male, Female (2007+) Grade levels: Pre-K, K, 1-12, Ungraded

title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: Economic disadvantage status (separate data) Special education enrollment (separate system) English Learner counts (separate file) Pre-2006 data (PDFs )

title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: District ID: 5 digits (County code + district number, e.g., 49005) School ID: 2 digits within district Campus ID: 7 digits (District ID + School ID)

title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
code: # View cached files cache_status()  # Clear cache clear_cache()  # Force fresh download enr <- fetch_enr(2025, use_cache = FALSE)

what: Part of the 50 State Schooldata Family
title: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data
text: package part family R packages providing school enrollment data 50 US states. package fetches data directly state’s Department Education. See also: njschooldata - original state schooldata package New Jersey. packages: github.com/almartin82

what: Fetch South Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
title: Fetch South Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data South Dakota Department Education Fall Census enrollment files.

title: Fetch South Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
Fetch South Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - e.g., 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2006-2025. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download SD DOE.

title: Fetch South Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch South Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district sioux_falls <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(district_id == "49005") } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: sdschooldata: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data — sdschooldata-package
title: sdschooldata: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data — sdschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data South Dakota Department Education (SD DOE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data Fall Census counts transforming tidy format analysis. Supports historical data 2006 present.

title: sdschooldata: Fetch and Process South Dakota School Data — sdschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
